narrative.narrative:
# Your 2024: A Musical Odyssey of Questionable Choices

Let's address the elephant in the room: you spent **73 hours** listening to Chumbawamba in 2024. That's right—while everyone else was having their tasteful Kendrick Lamar phase, you were out here getting knocked down (and getting up again) 1,314 times. Respect? Maybe. Concern? Definitely.

You crushed **12,821 tracks** this year, racking up over **670 hours** of listening time. That's basically a full month of your life. You could've learned Mandarin. Instead, you learned every Descendents song ever recorded (686 plays worth).

## The Shit Present Situation

Somewhere around mid-year, you discovered Shit Present's "What Still Gets Me" and decided to make it everyone's problem. You played this album 307 times. Your top 10 tracks? Nine of them are from this album. The only intruder? "Redbone" by Childish Gambino, which you played 50 times—26 of those AFTER MIDNIGHT. Were you okay? Are you okay now?

Actually, let's talk about March 7th. You listened to "Redbone" **26 times in one day**. That's not a vibe, that's a cry for help set to a funky bassline.

## Your Personality Disorder (Musically Speaking)

Your top artists are basically a fever dream: anarcho-punk legends, California skate punks, Kendrick Lamar (thank god, something critically acclaimed), and then... Eminem and 50 Cent? You played "Get Rich or Die Tryin'" 203 times. Somewhere between "Tubthumping" and "In Da Club," your Spotify algorithm just gave up trying to understand you.

## The Numbers Don't Lie (But They Do Judge)

- **5,153 unique tracks** across 326 artists
- Peak listening: **8 AM on Fridays** (work from home energy)
- **45-day listening streak**—someone's commitment issues don't extend to music
- July was your MONTH with 2,428 plays. What happened? New job? Breakup? Just vibes?

You essentially maintained a diet of 90s punk, experimental noise, and Grammy-winning hip-hop, blended together like a smoothie nobody asked for.

## The Verdict

You're the person who has Ween, NOFX, and The Mr. T Experience in their top 10, but also isn't afraid to blast Gorillaz's "Demon Days" 145 times. You're musically omnivorous, slightly unhinged, and honestly? The party playlist would be chaos, but we'd all stay.

Here's to 2025: may it involve slightly fewer Chumbawamba plays and maybe, just maybe, some therapy to process whatever "Redbone at 3 AM" was really about. 🍻

personality.type: The Anarcho-Punk Scholar with a Hip-Hop Minor
personality.tagline: Tubthumping through life with 73 hours of Chumbawamba and zero regrets
personality.description: You're the living embodiment of a 90s punk house show that somehow got a PhD in Kendrick Lamar studies. With Chumbawamba consuming 11% of your entire year and a Shit Present album on repeat like it's your emotional support record, you've achieved what scientists call 'maximum punk commitment.' You listened to 'Redbone' 50 times (26 of those after midnight on a single day in March—you good?). Your taste says 'I was definitely at Warped Tour' but also 'I respect lyrical genius,' bouncing from Descendents to Eminem like it's perfectly normal. You're either working through something deep or you've discovered the secret to happiness is just... never leaving 1997's punk scene except for strategic hip-hop breaks.
personality.spirit_animal: A leather-jacketed philosophy professor who secretly freestyles in their car

roasts: You listened to Chumbawamba for 73 HOURS this year. You got knocked down, you got up again, and apparently you never stopped getting up again for the entire year.
Playing 'Redbone' 26 times in a single day on March 7th? That's not a vibe, that's a cry for help. Someone check if they're okay.
Your top 9 tracks are ALL from the same Shit Present album. We get it, you found an album you like, but there are literally 1,051 other albums in your library begging for attention.

You spent over 1,400 minutes listening to Descendents but your music taste is definitely still having an identity crisis - going from Chumbawamba to 50 Cent to Ween like a caffeinated DJ with commitment issues.
Peak listening at 8 AM on Fridays? Nothing says 'living your best life' like starting your weekend morning commute with a band literally called Shit Present.

aura.description: Your aura radiates the raw energy of a DIY punk show colliding with golden-age hip-hop swagger. Chumbawamba's anarcho-punk spirit dominates your sonic landscape, wrapped in the melodic fury of 90s skate punk and underground grit. You're a morning warrior—your peak listening at 8 AM reveals someone who starts their day with conviction, not coffee. That obsessive 26-play loop of 'Redbone' at 3 AM in March? Pure chaotic bliss. Your 45-day listening streak shows devotion that rivals any religious practice. You exist in the sweet spot between mosh pit and mixtape, where Kendrick's lyricism shares space with NOFX's snark, and Ween's weirdness feels perfectly at home. You're allergic to the mainstream but unafraid to let Eminem and 50 Cent crash the party. Your aura screams: 'I know what I like, I like it loud, and I'll play it until the algorithm breaks.'

superlatives.award: Most Likely to Start a Revolution (While Tubthumping)
superlatives.reason: Spent 73+ hours with Chumbawamba this year—that's enough time to get knocked down AND get up again at least 1,314 times
Played Childish Gambino's 'Redbone' 50 times, including 26 times after midnight. Stay woke? More like stayed AWAKE.

superlatives.award: Most Committed to Ironic Band Names
superlatives.reason: Gave 'Shit Present' 493 plays. That's not a shit present—that's a COMMITMENT to punk rock realness
Peak listening at 8 AM and 5 PM. Nothing says 'corporate rebellion' like blasting Descendents and NOFX during work hours
Seamlessly pivoted from anarcho-punk Chumbawamba to Kendrick Lamar to Eminem. Musical whiplash is a lifestyle choice

hot_takes: You listened to Chumbawamba for 73 HOURS this year. That's not 'ironic appreciation,' that's a cry for help disguised as anarcho-punk
Playing 'Redbone' 26 times in one day AND making it your late-night anthem? We get it, you saw Get Out once and it changed your life
Your top tracks are literally just one Shit Present album on repeat. At least try to gaslight us into thinking you explored their discography
Going from Kendrick Lamar to NOFX to Ween is the musical equivalent of personality disorder - pick a vibe and commit to the bit
You've got 50 Cent and Descendents both in heavy rotation. This is what happens when your teenage ska phase never ended but you also discovered hip-hop in college

suggestions: With 1,314 Chumbawamba plays, you're basically an anarcho-punk historian. Time to deep-dive into Crass, Conflict, and Propagandhi's back catalog—your 2025 needs more political fury.

You played 'Redbone' 50 times (including 26 times after midnight on a single day in March). Childish Gambino clearly has your soul. Chase that vibe with Frank Ocean's 'Blonde' and Blood Orange for more genre-bending R&B excellence.
Descendents + NOFX + Mr. T Experience = you're living in 90s pop-punk heaven. Complete the circle with Jawbreaker, Dillinger Four, and The Lillingtons before 2025 ends.
That Shit Present album got absolutely demolished (307 plays!). UK post-punk is your jam, so explore Dry Cleaning, Sinister Purpose, and The Chisel for similar snarky, angular energy.
You balanced Kendrick Lamar and Eminem with hardcore punk perfectly. 2025 prediction: you'll discover clipping., Death Grips, or Ho99o9—where aggressive hip-hop meets absolute chaos.
